quote_first: They parked the car outside Lowther’s at precisely
quote_last: . People were leaving, not all of them happy at having their evening curtailed. But the grumbling was muted, and even then it only started once they were safely on the street.
title: The Complaints
author: Ian Rankin

quote_first:
For the rest of the evening, nobody talked. They just drank, ate, sat in different parts of the shack. Sarah bit her nails, pretended to be busy at the food table. Kendra sat on the couch, her knees pulled up, her head in her arms. Christy stood by the window, examining the rain, her arms crossed, her face pinched.
At
title: Reprieve
author: James Han Mattson
